Pre-Game Insights: The West Indies will enter the T20 World Cup 2024 as one of the top contenders for the title.
The hosts have been in excellent form leading up to the tournament, coming off an impressive series win against South Africa and a victory over Australia in a warm-up match.
With immense power in their lineup, a strong performance from just two or three players can be enough to overcome even the toughest opponents.
They likely possess the best batting lineup in the tournament.
While upsets in T20 cricket are not uncommon, PNG appears to lack the quality necessary to challenge this formidable West Indies team, even if they play their best cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in Guyana has been wet recently, with potential rain interruptions expected.
Humidity levels are expected to be around 80 percent, and the wind speed will be approximately 15 km/h.

The wicket at Providence Stadium in Guyana is expected to be conducive to good cricket. Both pacers and spinners will find some assistance from the pitch, while batters can score quickly once set, thanks to the fast outfield and short boundaries.
Others: The West Indies squad includes Rovman Powell (c), Johnson Charles, Brandon King, Nicholas Pooran (w), Shimron Hetmyer, Sherfane Rutherford, Andre Russell, Akeal Hosein, Obed McCoy, Shamar Joseph, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie, Shai Hope, Roston Chase, Romario Shepherd.

The Papua New Guinea squad includes Kushal Bhurtel, Sundeep Jora (w), Aasif Sheikh (w), Anil Sah, Rohit Paudel (c), Dipendra Singh Airee, Lalit Rajbanshi, Pratis GC, Kamal Singh Airee, Kushal Malla, Karan KC, Gulsan Jha, Sompal Kami, Sagar Dhakal.
